1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: wn_log.c Sun 11-19-2000 10:48:25 pm HvA V1.00 $
3    | Disk logging routines
4    | HISTORY: 920919 V1.0    
5    | ***************************************************************************/
6    | 
7    | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8    |                         HEADER FILES
9    | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
10   | #include <stdio.h>
11   | #include <stdlib.h>
12   | #include <stdarg.h>
13   | #include <string.h>
14   | #include "window.h"
15   | 
16   | static int indent_len = 0;
17   | static char indent_str[80];
18   | 
19   | 
20   | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
21   |     FUNCTION: wn_log_indent()
22   |      PURPOSE: Set indent in window stream loggin
23   |       SYNTAX: int wn_log_indent(int i);
24   |  DESCRIPTION: int i: Number of spaces to add to indentation
25   |      RETURNS: 0 if all OK, -1 if error occured.
26   |      HISTORY: 920919 V0.1
27   | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
28   | int wn_log_indent(int adjust_len)
29   | {
30   |  int i;
31   | 
32   |  /*----------------------------------
33   |    Adjust number of spaces to indent
34   |  -----------------------------------*/
35   |  indent_len += adjust_len;
36   | 
37   |  /*-----------------------------------------------------
38   |    Check on valid indent lenght: 0 <= indent_len <= 40
39   |    return 0 if OK, -1 if not
40   |  -----------------------------------------------------*/
41   |  if (indent_len < 0)
42   |    indent_len = 0;
43   |  if (indent_len > 40)
44   |    indent_len = 40;
45   | 
46   |  /*-----------------
47   |    Set the string
48   |  -----------------*/
49   |  i = 0;
50   |  while (i < indent_len)
51   |    indent_str[i++] = 0x20;
52   |  indent_str[i] = '\0';
53   | 
54   |  return(0);
55   | 
56   | }
57   | 
58   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
59   |    FUNCTION: wn_log()
60   |     PURPOSE: Log window actions to a log file
61   |      SYNTAX: void wn_log(char *format, ...);
62   | DESCRIPTION: If 'WN_LOG' is defined, a file called 'window.log' will be
63   |              opened. The arguments given will be printed in the logfile.
64   |              The format of the arguments is the same as for 'printf()'.
65   |     RETURNS: nothing
66   |     HISTORY: 920203 V0.1 - Initial version
67   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
68   | void wn_log(char *format, ...)
69   | {
70   |   va_list arguments;
71   |   static char *ep = NULL;     /* Points to environment var that names file */
72   |   FILE *fp = NULL;
73   | 
74   |   if (ep == NULL                /* First time through, just create blank file */
75   |   && (ep = getenv("WN_LOG"))
76   |   && (fp = fopen(ep,"w")) ) {
77   |     fclose(fp);
78   |     fp = NULL;
79   |     indent_str[0] = '\0';
80   |   }
81   | 
82   |   if (ep)  {                     /* If we have a filename, proceed */
83   |     fp = fopen(ep,"r+");
84   |     if (!fp) {
85   |       fprintf(stderr,"\nCannot open %s\n\a",ep);
86   |       return;
87   |     }
88   |     else {
89   |       va_start(arguments,format);       /* va_... housekeeping             */
90   |       fseek(fp,0L,SEEK_END);            /* position pointer on end of file */
91   |       fprintf(fp,"%s",indent_str);      /* place indentation               */
92   |       vfprintf(fp,format,arguments);    /* print the log message           */
93   |       fclose(fp);                       /* close the file                  */
94   |     } va_end(arguments);                /* va_... housekeeping             */
95   | 
96   |   }
97   | }
